member.name: T:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageScope
member.summary: Enumerates the levels of isolated storage scope that are supported by .

member.name: F:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageScope.Application
member.summary: Isolated storage scoped to the application.

member.name: F:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageScope.Assembly
member.summary: Isolated storage scoped to the identity of the assembly.

member.name: F:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageScope.Domain
member.summary: Isolated storage scoped to the application domain identity.

member.name: F:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageScope.Machine
member.summary: Isolated storage scoped to the machine.

member.name: F:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageScope.None
member.summary: No isolated storage usage.

member.name: F:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageScope.Roaming
member.summary: The isolated store can be placed in a location on the file system that might roam (if roaming user data is enabled on the underlying operating system).

member.name: F:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageScope.User
member.summary: Isolated storage scoped by user identity.

member.name: M:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFileStream.BeginRead(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous read.
member.param: The buffer to read data into.
The byte offset in buffer at which to begin reading.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
The method to call when the asynchronous read operation is completed. This parameter is optional.
The status of the asynchronous read.
member.returns: An object that represents the asynchronous read, which is possibly still pending. This must be passed to this stream's method to determine how many bytes were read. This can be done either by the same code that called or in a callback passed to .
member.exception: An asynchronous read was attempted past the end of the file.

member.name: M:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFileStream.BeginWrite(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous write.
member.param: The buffer to write data to.
The byte offset in buffer at which to begin writing.
The maximum number of bytes to write.
The method to call when the asynchronous write operation is completed. This parameter is optional.
The status of the asynchronous write.
member.returns: An that represents the asynchronous write, which is possibly still pending. This must be passed to this stream's method to ensure that the write is complete, then frees resources appropriately. This can be done either by the same code that called or in a callback passed to .
member.exception: An asynchronous write was attempted past the end of the file.

member.name: M:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFileStream.EndRead(System.IAsyncResult)

member.exception: The asyncResult is .

member.summary: Ends an asynchronous write.
member.param: The pending asynchronous I/O request to end.
member.exception: The asyncResult parameter is .

member.param: to flush all intermediate file buffers; otherwise, .

member.returns: The length of the object in bytes.

member.summary: Prevents other processes from reading from or writing to the stream.
member.param: The starting position of the range to lock. The value of this parameter must be equal to or greater than 0 (zero).
The number of bytes to lock.
member.exception: position or length is negative.
The file is closed.
The process cannot access the file because another process has locked a portion of the file.

member.summary: Gets or sets the current position of the current object.
member.returns: The current position of this object.
member.exception: The position cannot be set to a negative number.

member.name: M:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFileStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies bytes from the current buffered object to an array.
member.param: The buffer to read.
The offset in the buffer at which to begin writing.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFileStream.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a single byte from the object in isolated storage.

member.name: M:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFile.GetUserStoreForSite
member.summary: Obtains a user-scoped isolated store for use by applications in a virtual host domain.
member.returns: The isolated storage file that corresponds to the isolated storage scope based on the calling code's application identity.

member.name: T:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an operation in isolated storage fails.

member.name: M:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default properties.

member.name: M:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.name: M:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.
member.param: The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.

member.name: M:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the inner parameter is not , the current exception is raised in a block that handles the inner exception.

member.name: T:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorage
member.summary: Represents the abstract base class from which all isolated storage implementations must derive.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorage.ApplicationIdentity
member.summary: Gets an application identity that scopes isolated storage.
member.returns: An that represents the identity.
member.exception: The code lacks the required to access this object. These permissions are granted by the runtime based on security policy.
The object is not isolated by the application .

member.name: P:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorage.AssemblyIdentity
member.summary: Gets an assembly identity used to scope isolated storage.
member.returns: An that represents the identity.
member.exception: The code lacks the required to access this object.
The assembly is not defined.

member.name: P:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorage.AvailableFreeSpace
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the available free space for isolated storage, in bytes.
member.returns: The available free space for isolated storage, in bytes.
member.exception: An operation was performed that requires access to , but that property is not defined for this store. Stores that are obtained by using enumerations do not have a well-defined property, because partial evidence is used to open the store.

member.name: P:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorage.CurrentSize
member.summary: Gets a value representing the current size of isolated storage.
member.returns: The number of storage units currently used within the isolated storage scope.
member.exception: The current size of the isolated store is undefined.

member.name: P:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorage.DomainIdentity
member.summary: Gets a domain identity that scopes isolated storage.
member.returns: An that represents the identity.
member.exception: The code lacks the required to access this object. These permissions are granted by the runtime based on security policy.
The object is not isolated by the domain .

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, prompts a user to approve a larger quota size, in bytes, for isolated storage.
member.param: The requested new quota size, in bytes, for the user to approve.
member.returns: in all cases.

member.name: P:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorage.MaximumSize
member.summary: Gets a value representing the maximum amount of space available for isolated storage. When overridden in a derived class, this value can take different units of measure.
member.returns: The maximum amount of isolated storage space in bytes. Derived classes can return different units of value.

member.name: P:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorage.Quota
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that represents the maximum amount of space available for isolated storage.
member.returns: The limit of isolated storage space, in bytes.
member.exception: An operation was performed that requires access to , but that property is not defined for this store. Stores that are obtained by using enumerations do not have a well-defined property, because partial evidence is used to open the store.

member.name: M:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorage.Remove
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, removes the individual isolated store and all contained data.

member.name: P:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorage.Scope
member.summary: Gets an enumeration value specifying the scope used to isolate the store.
member.returns: A bitwise combination of values specifying the scope used to isolate the store.

member.name: P:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorage.SeparatorExternal
member.summary: Gets a backslash character that can be used in a directory string. When overridden in a derived class, another character might be returned.
member.returns: The default implementation returns the '\' (backslash) character.

member.name: P:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorage.SeparatorInternal
member.summary: Gets a period character that can be used in a directory string. When overridden in a derived class, another character might be returned.
member.returns: The default implementation returns the '.' (period) character.

member.name: P:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorage.UsedSize
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that represents the amount of the space used for isolated storage.
member.returns: The used amount of isolated storage space, in bytes.
member.exception: An operation was performed that requires access to , but that property is not defined for this store. Stores that are obtained by using enumerations do not have a well-defined property, because partial evidence is used to open the store.

member.name: T:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.INormalizeForIsolatedStorage
member.summary: Enables comparisons between an isolated store and an application domain and assembly's evidence.

member.name: M:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.INormalizeForIsolatedStorage.Normalize
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns a normalized copy of the object on which it is called.
member.returns: A normalized object that represents the instance on which this method was called. This instance can be a string, stream, or any serializable object.
